laboratory_examinations.findings: The gallbladder demonstrates numerous shadowing stones, with a large stone measuring 1.8 cm lodged in the gallbladder neck. The gallbladder is slightly distended with mild wall edema (4 mm). The liver shows diffusely increased echogenicity suggestive of fatty infiltration. The common bile duct measures 7 mm, at the upper limits of normal. No intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation or ascites noted.
Potassium level is 3.9 mEq/L, which is within normal range (ref range: 3.5 - 5.3 mEq/L).
